title: Sketch Class: Go Pop—Subjects and Techniques
short_description: Pop artists like Andy Warhol brought the world around them into the space of the art gallery. Make your own drawings inspired by their innovative techniques. This program is for people ages 16 and up. All materials will be provided.
description:
Six Saturdays
November 2–December 14 (no class on November 30)
10:45–12:45 

Pop artists like Andy Warhol brought the world around them into the space of the art gallery. Make your own drawings inspired by their innovative techniques.

About the Instructor
Mark Krisco is an art history lecturer and sketch instructor with over 25 years of experience at the Art Institute. In addition to lecturing at SAIC and the Oxford Round Table, he has served as curator for the Dr. Martin and Francey Gecht Collection, the Marshall Field’s Archives, and the Pope John Paul II Newman Center in Washington, DC.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
